title: Computer Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of computer fundamentals, internet safety, and file management

questions.question: What is the main screen of your computer called?
questions.explanation: The desktop is the main screen where you see icons and can access programs. It's like your computer's workspace.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a hardware component?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Word is software (a program), while monitor, keyboard, and mouse are hardware (physical parts you can touch).

questions.question: What should you do when you're finished using your computer?
options: Just turn off the power switch
Click the Start button, then 'Shut down'
Close all programs and leave it on
questions.explanation: Always use the proper shutdown process to avoid losing work and damaging your computer. Never just turn off the power!

questions.question: What is the purpose of a web browser?
options: To visit websites on the internet
questions.explanation: A web browser (like Chrome, Firefox, or Edge) is the program you use to visit websites and browse the internet.

questions.question: Which of these is a safe internet practice?
options: Never sharing personal information with strangers
questions.explanation: Never share personal information with strangers online. This is one of the most important internet safety rules.

questions.question: What is a folder used for?
options: To organize files on your computer
questions.explanation: Folders help you organize files into groups, like putting clothes in different drawers. They keep your computer organized.

questions.question: What does the address bar in a web browser show?
questions.explanation: The address bar shows the website address (URL) of the page you're currently viewing, like 'www.google.com'.

questions.question: What is the correct way to open a program?
options: Click the Start button and find the program name
Turn the computer off and on again
Press random keys on the keyboard
questions.explanation: To open a program, click the Start button, look for the program name in the menu, and click on it.

questions.question: What is a search engine?
options: A website that helps you find information online
questions.explanation: A search engine like Google helps you find information on the internet by searching through websites.

questions.question: What should you do if you're unsure about something on the internet?
options: Click on everything to find out
Share it with everyone you know
Ask a trusted adult for help
questions.explanation: If you're unsure about something online, always ask a trusted adult for help. It's better to be safe than sorry!

questions.question: You should never share your password with anyone, not even your best friend.
questions.explanation: Your password is like a key to your digital life. Never share it with anyone, even people you trust.

questions.question: It's okay to click on pop-up ads that promise free prizes.
questions.explanation: Pop-up ads promising free prizes are usually scams. Never click on them as they can harm your computer.

questions.question: You can create folders to organize your files on the computer.
questions.explanation: Creating folders is a great way to organize your files. You can group similar files together in folders.

questions.question: The internet is completely safe and you can trust everything you see online.
questions.explanation: Not everything on the internet is true or safe. Always think critically and verify information from reliable sources.

questions.question: You should save your work regularly when using programs like Notepad or Word.
questions.explanation: Always save your work regularly to avoid losing it if your computer crashes or you accidentally close the program.

questions.question: Match each computer part with its function:

pairs.definition: Shows what you're doing on the computer
Used for typing letters and numbers
Helps you click and move around on screen
Play sounds and music from your computer

questions.question: Match each file type with what it contains:

pairs.definition: Documents that look the same on any computer

questions.question: The __________ is the main screen of your computer where you see icons.
questions.explanation: The desktop is your computer's main workspace where you can see icons and access programs.

questions.question: A __________ is a program that helps you find information on the internet.
questions.explanation: Search engines like Google help you find websites and information on the internet.

questions.question: __________ are physical parts of your computer that you can touch.
questions.explanation: Hardware includes all the physical parts of your computer like the monitor, keyboard, and mouse.
